Title: Query by Document ID
DescriptionLines: Use a **Query by Document ID** to get a specific document from the database.
Similar to the full collection query, no index is created.
RavenDB uses the raw collection documents as the source for this query.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on collection 'Employees' using the Session `QueryCollectionForType()` method.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the document ID to query by
DescriptionLines: * Use `Where()` to query for a specific document from the 'Employees' collection.
Specify the document ID - the results will include only this document.
* No index will be created - the raw collection documents are used as the source for this query.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * The 'queryByDocumentId' variable only stores the query definition.
Execute the query by calling `Single()` to get the matching document.
'Single()' will return an error if no match is found, or if results contain more than 1 document.
* The 'employee' variable will hold the resulting matching document entity.
* The entity returned by the Query operation is _'loaded'_ to the session.
